page.title: 19Colchester's Mercury Statue.
page.content: { "The Mercury Statue"}was found in a shed at Gosbecks farm Stanway, having been dug up earlier, in 1948. It turned up whilst a ploughman was ploughing the field. It was one of the most important works of art ever found in Britain. It had proved that the {"Gallo Roman Temple"}was in Chestnut field, only a few 100 yards from where it was found. The figure is 22 inches high while some other statues are up to 10 inches high. It represented a God to the Romans. The arms are missing below the elbows, but we are fairly certain that it could be Mercury because the hands originally held the Caduceus and a purse which he used as his symbols. The right leg is damaged at the knee because it was struck by the plough when it was found. The position of the God was standing on a Globe.
